page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT: BROWNHILLS AREA.
page.content: In the Brownhills/Walsall Wood area coalmining and brickmaking were traditionally the principal forms of employment. However, since 1945 there has been more diversification, light industries having been established eg. metalworking on the Maybrook Industrial Estate. Brickworks and sand and gravel quarries still provide some work but coalmining came to an end in 1964. Many workers are employed in the Birmingham and Black Country conurbation whilst others travel to the pits in the Cannock area. The eastern, agricultural area provides limited employment. Stonnall is largely a dormitory settlement, residents commuting to nearby urban centres. Unemployment has grown in recent years. 2354 people were unemployed in July 1985 (1715 males, 639 females).
